ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During social interactions with others the past week, I felt like I didn't fit in with others.
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= Extremely; 999= NA, was not around others

ElementDescription: During social interactions with others the past week, I enjoyed my interactions with people.
Notes: 0= Not at all; 6= Extremely; 999= NA, was not around others

ElementDescription: During social interactions with others the past week, Someone got upset with me.
How much time did you spend socializing with people (in person, phone, text, video chat or on social media)?
Notes: 0= 0 minutes; 1= Less than 30 minutes; 2= 30-60 minutes; 3= about 1 hour; 4= about 2 hours; 5= about 3 hours; 6= about 4 hours; 7= about 5 hours; 8= about 6 hours; 9= about 7 hours; 10= about 8 hours; 11= about 9 hours; 12= about 10 hours; 13= about 11 hours; 14= about 12 hours

ElementDescription: What percentage of this time was in person?
What percentage of this time was spent on socialmedia (posting, commenting, browsing)?
What percentage of this time was spent talking byphone, text, or video?
How would you rate the quality of your social interactions?
Notes: 0 = Very negative; 1= Negative; 2= Somewhat Negative; 3= Neutral; 4= Somewhat Postive; 5= Positive; 6 = Very positive
